Reason: The configuration 'enableAntiAliasing' is performance-sensitive because enabling anti-aliasing can significantly impact system performance by increasing processing time and resource usage, especially for larger images or when applied to a large number of images. This configuration directly affects the execution time and memory consumption at the system level, making it performance-sensitive. Additionally, the 'enableAntiAliasing' configuration triggers the application of the OP_ANTIALIAS filter whenever the 'loadPrefs' method is called, which can happen frequently during application startup or when the user changes settings, further emphasizing its performance impact.
